comment.label_en: <center>Security models are used to define rules for setting role attributes on documents</center>
This is the name that is used to refer to the model.
What is this model used for, can be used to ensure it is selectable only for its intended use.
Groups from this generator (once resolved) can alter the role attributes on the document

combo.assistance_dql: select generator_name from lss_sec_group_gen where is_selectable = 1 order by 1

comment.label_en: The attributes that the document admin can modify
Groups from this generator (once resolved) can alter the model for this document via the change model action. Generally the target models would be restricted models.

combo.assistance_dql: select generator_name from lss_sec_group_gen where is_selectable = 1 order by 1

comment.label_en: A CDF expression that when resolved represents a value that would be the same for documents that should use the same shared key generator.

0 means that this model is only used by resolving on the reference model. Other numbers are used to filter the list when the user opts to restrict the document and picks an associated restriction level.
Clear out attributes that may have been set by other models. No need to include Attributes that are set by the model - those are cleared automatically.

list.assistance_dql: select distinct attr_name from dm_type where attr_repeating = 1 and attr_name not like '_/_%' escape '/' order by 1 enable (ROW_BASED)
list.label_en: Attributes to clear from the document

list.assistance_dql: select distinct attr_name from dm_type where attr_repeating = 1 and attr_name not like '_/_%' escape '/' order by 1 enable (ROW_BASED)
list.label_en: Attributes to clear from the shared object

combo.assistance_dql: select distinct attr_name from dm_type where attr_repeating = 1 and attr_name not like '_/_%' escape '/' order by 1 enable (ROW_BASED)
select generator_name from lss_sec_group_gen where is_selectable = 1 order by 1
